title: Problem-Solving Skill Improvement Program Through Experimental Task Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental logical reasoning and comprehension of basic scientific concepts
context.additional_context: Mobile learning conducted in a limited technological environment based on smartphones, focusing on developing work-applicable problem-solving skills through short-term intensive courses for working professionals

learning_goals: Learners can compare problem-solving strategies across three experimental environments (computer/mental/physical simulations) and select the optimal approach.
Learners can reduce complex problem-solving time by 20% using working memory load management techniques.
Learners apply systematic problem-solving steps through Tower of Hanoi-like tasks and achieve a minimum move success rate of over 85%.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
